sentences.sContent: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.sCn: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.sContent: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.sCn: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.sContent: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.sCn: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

sentences.sContent: ...a real innovative company should develop an innovation culture and use it as a primary tool for success...
...its corporate culture was too rooted in the successes of the past for it to make the clean break necessary to fullyembrace the future...
...Just under 50% said they were interested in reading about their own culture and tradition...
...The culture of other countries doesn't support the kind of innovation that Steve Jobs exemplifies...
...the brilliant historic culture of the Central Avenue can widen people’s vision and enhance their knowledge...
...as he would in his own culture when making known the height of a child...
...its corporate culture was too rooted in the successes of the past for it to make the clean break necessary to fully embrace the future...
...According to O'Sullivan culture also shapes the sorts of feelings we expect to have...
...Just under 50% said they were interested in reading about their own culture in tradition...
...and your culture tells you that this is what a long-term relationship should be based on...

phrases.pCn: 大众文化，通俗文化；流行文化

trans.tranOther: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society
